snippet.textDisplay:
Since the purchase by the Glazers, Utd has been rubbish. American owners will ruin a club quickly as they have no passion for the game. Americans do not understand football. My country men don’t even call the beautiful game football because we have that other game that is built for dullards. It is quite saddening.

Look at Arsenal as well.

The assumption that wealthy people have a high business acumen is false. They just inherit, and never have to work hard, learn or grow mentally.

snippet.textDisplay: I agree with most things except for Fred. Ok, he isn't a top midfielder but he's been our most consistent player over the last 3 months. He's ability to play quick, one time passes has been the only time our midfield has looked ok. But having him play so deep is a detriment to his abilities. He's not a CDM or a deep lying playmaker. He's a box to box midfielder but you need a CDM behind him, in order to get the best out of him. He's being singled out because of the price tag we paid for him. He might not live up to the price tag, but he's made a massive improvements from when he first started for us. He's good enough to be in the squad, if United improve and get back to their best then he may no longer start. But he's shown that he's an important player for us. For most United fans, he's the second best midfielder at the club.
snippet.textOriginal: I agree with most things except for Fred. Ok, he isn't a top midfielder but he's been our most consistent player over the last 3 months. He's ability to play quick, one time passes has been the only time our midfield has looked ok. But having him play so deep is a detriment to his abilities. He's not a CDM or a deep lying playmaker. He's a box to box midfielder but you need a CDM behind him, in order to get the best out of him. He's being singled out because of the price tag we paid for him. He might not live up to the price tag, but he's made a massive improvements from when he first started for us. He's good enough to be in the squad, if United improve and get back to their best then he may no longer start. But he's shown that he's an important player for us. For most United fans, he's the second best midfielder at the club.

snippet.textDisplay: It's complete Bullshit how you can admit that Manchester United have a completely awful squad but then you say Ole needs to go???? Ole is doing his best to reconstruct this train wreck into a future force with the right players and mentality, look at what he had to work with! It's going to take years to replace the rot in the team and build a decent base... Let alone a whole squad that's capable of competing for everything. Ole strengthened the Defence with Maguire AWB and brought through Williams let him continue with the midfield, plus get our 2 current best CM's back from injury and a little creativity up top and he has a great structure to push on with and add to. Sacking Ole for everything bad that he has inherited from past managers is just going to set the club back to square one again

snippet.textDisplay:
Utd can't simply keep sacking managers. The "change" the need right now is to waste no time and pay whatever it takes to get top midfielders in. The new players since Solskjaer's arrival, whether they've been new signings or promoted from the academy have all done well individually. Maguire hasn't really looked like an £80m centre-back but it's too much to do with a poor midfield in front of him. Wan-Bissaka and James have been excellent. Greenwood and Brandon Williams look made for it!! James Garner and Levitt have done well when they've played.

It was never expected that utd would instantly get up to the level of City and Liverpool when Mourinho left, they were in a calamitous situation. Apart from this game and against Arsenal they've done well against the better teams. They need to back Solskjaer and sign the likes of Maddison, Grealish, Rice, Van de Beek. If they get 2 or 3 players like this lot and still fail to beat the lower teams in the league, then it would be understandable to change management again... What would one of the elite managers do that would make a team with too many weak links suddenly become one of the best??? There's nothing any manager can do apart from strengthen the squad. Problem is that right now strengthening the squad doesn't mean bringing in back up players. They need really top players in midfield to progress.
They are currently without their 2 BEST central midfielders to be fair! Even Liverpool would really struggle to beat city if 2 out of Henderson, Fabinho and Keita were out.
snippet.textOriginal:
Utd can't simply keep sacking managers. The "change" the need right now is to waste no time and pay whatever it takes to get top midfielders in. The new players since Solskjaer's arrival, whether they've been new signings or promoted from the academy have all done well individually. Maguire hasn't really looked like an £80m centre-back but it's too much to do with a poor midfield in front of him. Wan-Bissaka and James have been excellent. Greenwood and Brandon Williams look made for it!! James Garner and Levitt have done well when they've played. 

It was never expected that utd would instantly get up to the level of City and Liverpool when Mourinho left, they were in a calamitous situation. Apart from this game and against Arsenal  they've done well against the better teams. They need to back Solskjaer and sign the likes of Maddison, Grealish, Rice, Van de Beek. If they get 2 or 3 players like this lot and still fail to beat the lower teams in the league, then it would be understandable to change management again... What would one of the elite managers do that would make a team with too many weak links suddenly become one of the best??? There's nothing any manager can do apart from strengthen the squad. Problem is that right now strengthening the squad doesn't mean bringing in back up players. They need really top players in midfield to progress.
They are currently without their 2 BEST central midfielders to be fair! Even Liverpool would really struggle to beat city if 2 out of Henderson, Fabinho and Keita were out.

snippet.textDisplay:
How to fix Man United:

1) Hire a Sporting Director
2) Bring in a manager that will focus on a suitable style of play and apply that consistently. We should be a team comfortable in possession, not afraid to go forward and are able to defend as a unit. Counter attacks don't cut it I'm afraid
3) Get rid of Phil Jones and Jesse Lingard. Also sell Smalling to Roma for extra cash
4) Sign cheaper, talented players. We don't need players from England. Just players that can speak English. Look for quality in the second division early. Look in South America, Asia and Africa for players. Mane literally has way less value in football simply because he is not English.
5) Ditch the 4231 that every person likes to go for now. 2 striker formations are a must. Should be playing a variation of 442 and 433 against weaker teams. Trying to make smart combinations and create goals.
6) Do not give in to players outrageous wage demands. Pogba and Rashford probably the only players in my opinion who deserve the wages their on.
7) Fire Ed Woodward
8) Whoever plays on the pitch for United must be passionate about the club. Fergie had a squad where he trusted every player to be at their best, and directed them to glory. Ole has to work with deadwood in Lingard, Mata, Pereira, Jones and a plethora of injuries to important players. Martial, Pogba, Maguire, Tuanzabe, Shaw, McTominay. It's half a team. There aren't any good replacements.

This club has a lot to do to reach a title again. United can win a title this decade, it just depends on how we handle things. We as fans cannot accept this but unfortunately we can't do anything. I will die supporting this club and I just hope to see many more titles come to Old Trafford
snippet.textOriginal:
How to fix Man United: 

1) Hire a Sporting Director
2) Bring in a manager that will focus on a suitable style of play and apply that consistently. We should be a team comfortable in possession, not afraid to go forward and are able to defend as a unit. Counter attacks don't cut it I'm afraid 
3) Get rid of Phil Jones and Jesse Lingard. Also sell Smalling to Roma for extra cash 
4) Sign cheaper, talented players. We don't need players from England. Just players that can speak English. Look for quality in the second division early. Look in South America, Asia and Africa for players. Mane literally has way less value in football simply because he is not English. 
5) Ditch the 4231 that every person likes to go for now. 2 striker formations are a must. Should be playing a variation of 442 and 433 against weaker teams. Trying to make smart combinations and create goals. 
6) Do not give in to players outrageous wage demands. Pogba and Rashford probably the only players in my opinion who deserve the wages their on. 
7) Fire Ed Woodward 
8) Whoever plays on the pitch for United must be passionate about the club. Fergie had a squad where he trusted every player to be at their best, and directed them to glory. Ole has to work with deadwood in Lingard, Mata, Pereira, Jones and a plethora of injuries to important players. Martial, Pogba, Maguire, Tuanzabe, Shaw, McTominay. It's half a team. There aren't any good replacements. 

This club has a lot to do to reach a title again. United can win a title this decade, it just depends on how we handle things. We as fans cannot accept this but unfortunately we can't do anything. I will die supporting this club and I just hope to see many more titles come to Old Trafford

snippet.textDisplay:
One thing EVERYONE seems to miss … it was Fergusons arrogance in insisting a clone of himself in Moyes followed him denying the club the fresh start it desperately needed that has caused all that has followed .
His continued presence and influence is suffocating the club , demonstrated perfectly by the utterly laughable appointment of Solskjaer …. its the truth that nobody in the media or at the club dares to speak .

snippet.textDisplay: Mr Burley, your analysis of Matic and Fred is inaccurate.  Matic played in front of the back 4 and plugged that gaping hole. He can pass, he can take on players and he has decent work rate. I never rated Fred as a good player but he has improved drastically.  That comes from the immense game time he has gotten.  Same with Matic. If he plays more games he will get his form back. The problem with utd right now is tactics. Ole rather play Lingard then Matic?! Ole needs 3 midfielders. Mctominay, fred and matic in every game.
snippet.textOriginal: Mr Burley, your analysis of Matic and Fred is inaccurate.  Matic played in front of the back 4 and plugged that gaping hole. snippet.textDisplay:
The constant turnover of managers PROVES that nothing will be fixed unless something in the hierarchy does. I think it’s far-fetched to think that the owners will let go of their “baby” so to speak; however, a director of football is critical in the improvement of Manchester United.

One thing that I think will bring immediate change is a strike by Manchester United fans. Should they refrain from entering the stadium and paying to attend games, perhaps a change is imminent. The only way that happens is with collective congruence.
snippet.textOriginal:
The constant turnover of managers PROVES that nothing will be fixed unless something in the hierarchy does. I think it’s far-fetched to think that the owners will let go of their “baby” so to speak; however, a director of football is critical in the improvement of Manchester United. 

One thing that I think will bring immediate change is a strike by Manchester United fans. Should they refrain from entering the stadium and paying to attend games, perhaps a change is imminent. The only way that happens is with collective congruence.

snippet.textDisplay: I said it before even after we beat spurs and City that those were fluke games. I love Ole but he’s in way over his head. A team has to be consistent if you want to measure growth, and UTD under him are anything but. He’s a good guy but as I said b4 give Pochettino a chance because his record of getting young players to perform at Espanyol, Southampton, and Spurs is decent. Solskjaer has tried his best but UTD is too big a club to wait for a young coach who’s still learning his trade. Also, the management is really not doing him any favors by failing to invest in the squad. A billion dollar club should not just have only 1 good midfielder (Pogba) we need at least 3.
snippet.textOriginal: I said it before even after we beat spurs and City that those were fluke games. I love Ole but he’s in way over his head. A team has to be consistent if you want to measure growth, and UTD under him are anything but. He’s a good guy but as I said b4 give Pochettino a chance because his record of getting young players to perform at Espanyol, Southampton, and Spurs is decent. Solskjaer has tried his best but UTD is too big a club to wait for a young coach who’s still learning his trade. Also, the management is really not doing him any favors by failing to invest in the squad. A billion dollar club should not just have only 1 good midfielder (Pogba) we need at least 3.
